p: Respiration of the fresh-cut lettuce was evaluated by measuring the CO 2 concentration as previously described [ 15]. Briefly, samples were enclosed in a polypropylene plastic container (1 L) at room temperature for 1 h, container’s air was withdrawing by a dual gas analyzer (GCS 250 Analyzer, International Control Analyser Ltd., Kent, UK) for 40 s and respiration rate was expressed as mg of CO 2 per kg of fresh weight per h (mg kg −1 h −1 CO 2) according to the volume and weight of the processed lettuce. Ethylene flow rate was estimated by measuring the ethylene concentration of the packages as previously mentioned by Chrysargyris et al. [ 17]. Briefly, air was withdrawn from sample containers by an ethylene analyzer (ICA 56 Analyser, International Control Analyser Ltd., Kent, UK) for 20 s through a hole on the lid recording the ppm of ethylene produced, and ethylene emission was computed as μg of ethylene per kg of fresh weight per h (μg kg −1 h −1 ethylene).
